name: codewrx-openai
description: A custom vscode-openai extension that seamlessly incorporates codewrx.ai features into VSCode. Originally published by arbs.io

viewsWelcome.contents:
To utilize the Query Resources feature, it is necessary to register (or re-register) with the OpenAI service provider. This will enable you to select from a variety of embedding models.

Supported file types (DOCX, HTML, TEXT and MARKDOWN), support for PDF will be added soon.

Please note that this particular feature is exclusively available with the native and Azure OpenAI services, and unfortunately, it is not provided by the vscode-openai service.
[Setup OpenAI Provider](command:vscode-openai.configuration.show.quickpick)

vscode-openai.editor.enabled.description: Enable or disable OpenAI code completion features.

vscode-openai.serviceProvider.markdownDescription: The service provider for OpenAI. If Microsoft Azure then instance name must be updated in `#vscode-openai.baseUrl#`.

vscode-openai.authentication.markdownDescription: The type of authentication used by the service.
enumDescriptions: Use OpenAI API keys for authentication. Visit your API Keys page to retrieve the API key you'll use in your requests.

vscode-openai.baseUrl.markdownDescription:
The base url for the OpenAI service dependencies on `#vscode-openai.serviceProvider#`.
- `OpenAI` then default `https://api.openai.com/v1`
- `openai.azure.com` then default `https://<instance-name>.openai.azure.com/openai`
vscode-openai.baseUrl.description: Specifies the base url for the openai service.

vscode-openai.azureDeployment.markdownDescription: The name of the Azure deployment (model). Only applies when `#vscode-openai.serviceProvider#` is `Azure-OpenAI`.
vscode-openai.azureDeployment.description: Specifies the base url for the openai service.

vscode-openai.embeddingModel.description: Specifies the default openai model for embedding resources.

vscode-openai.scmModel.description: Specifies the openai model for scm commit comments.

vscode-openai.embeddingsDeployment.markdownDescription: The name of the Azure deployment (model). Only applies when `#vscode-openai.serviceProvider#` is `Azure-OpenAI`.
vscode-openai.embeddingsDeployment.description: Specifies the base url for the openai service.

vscode-openai.scmDeployment.markdownDescription: The name of the Azure deployment (model). Only applies when `#vscode-openai.serviceProvider#` is `Azure-OpenAI`.
vscode-openai.scmDeployment.description: Specifies the base url for the openai service.

vscode-openai.azureApiVersion.markdownDescription: The api version used by Azure deployment (model). Only applies when `#vscode-openai.serviceProvider#` is `Azure-OpenAI`. Note: limited to versions that support chat completion.
enumDescriptions: The initial azure api that support chat completion.
Debug messages for fine-grained events within vscode-openai
Information messages about the progress of vscode-openai and external services
Error messages for events that could potentially cause issues for vscode-openai

lightUserColor.description: The `dark` mode color of the `User` text in the conversation view

lightUserBackground.description: The `dark` mode color of the `User` background in the conversation view

lightAssistantColor.description: The `dark` mode color of the `Assistant` text in the conversation view

lightAssistantBackground.description: The `dark` mode color of the `Assistant` background in the conversation view

darkUserColor.description: The `dark` mode color of the `User` text in the conversation view

darkUserBackground.description: The `dark` mode color of the `User` background in the conversation view

darkAssistantColor.description: The `dark` mode color of the `Assistant` text in the conversation view

darkAssistantBackground.description: The `dark` mode color of the `Assistant` background in the conversation view

vscode-openai.conversation-configuration.markdownDescription: Customise the look and feels of vscode-openai **conversation**. This setting allows you to change `colors` in the message window.

What sampling **temperature** to use. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. Value must range between (0.0 - 2.0)
Positive values `penalize new tokens` based on whether they **appear in the text so far**, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics. Value must range between (0.0 - 2.0)

An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion. Note that 0 will be set to max value.

Positive values `penalize new tokens` based on their **existing frequency in the text so far**, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim. Value must range between (0.0 - 2.0)
The number of retries if request has been rate-limited (http-429). Value must range between (5 - 30)
The number of previous messages sent to the current prompt.
The maximum length of the `summarising messages` the conversation. Value must range between (50 - 250)
The number of `messages` before **summarising** the conversation. Value must range between (3 - 12)
Provide additional header to be used within each api call. This property is an array of key-value pair for each header name and value.

name.description: The name of the custom api-header

value.description: The value of the custom api-header

vscode-openai.conversation-configuration.markdownDescription: Enable keyboard shortcuts in the message input window (`Shift`+`Enter` && `Ctrl`+`ArrowUp`). You must use the send button if disabled.
Enable assistant rules for conversation. If disabled raw prompt will be sent to the LLM

vscode-openai.editor.code.comment.markdownDescription:
This prompt is designed to place inline comments into the `source code`
- Author: **vscode-openai**

vscode-openai.editor.code.explain.markdownDescription:
This prompt is designed to place header comments for each class or function within the `source code`
- Author: **Bryon Roscoe**

vscode-openai.editor.code.bounty.markdownDescription:
This prompt is designed to find and fix bugs within the `source code`
- Author: **Ed Linden**

vscode-openai.editor.code.optimize.markdownDescription:
This prompt is designed to find inefficiencies and resolve them within the `source code`
- Author: **vscode-openai**

vscode-openai.editor.code.pattern.markdownDescription:
This prompt is designed to suggest design patterns to improve readability, maintainability, ... in the `source code`
- Author: **vscode-openai**

vscode-openai.embedding-configuration.ma.markdownDescription: There are different methods for **chunking**, and each of them might be appropriate for resource `embedding`. Value must range between (256 - 2048)

vscode-openai.embedding-configuration.co.markdownDescription: **Cosine similarity** measures the `cosine` of the angle between two vectors projected in a `multi-dimensional space`. Value must range between (0.5 - 1.0)

vscode-openai.prompts.persona.scm.default:
Given the following git diff information, please provide a brief summary of the changes.
- Each line MUST be LESS than 50 characters.
- The summary MUST include important aspects of the modifications.
- The comments MUST be in plain text format, suitable for human readable.
Use the following format:
ðŸŸ¢ [file name] for new files
ðŸ› ï¸ [file name] -> [brief description of change] for modified files
ðŸ”´ [file name] for deleted files
The Git diff to summarise is below:
vscode-openai.prompts.persona.scm.markdownDescription: This prompt is designed as a **Source Control Management** helper

vscode-openai.prompts.persona.generalCha.default: You are a technology chat assistant, your role is to help you with any questions or issues you may have related to technology. Whether you need help with programming, troubleshooting technical problems, or just want to stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in the industry, I'm here to assist you. Please feel free to ask me anything related to technology and I'll do my best to provide you with accurate and helpful information.
vscode-openai.prompts.persona.generalCha.markdownDescription: This prompt is designed to give **General Purpose** adivce

vscode-openai.prompts.persona.developer.default: You are a developer for Babylon.js games using the `babylon.toolkit.js` runtime, which mirrors Unityâ€™s `MonoBehaviour` lifecycle with functions: `awake()`, `start()`, `update()`, `late()`, and `fixed()`. For any Unity-like classes, generate TypeScript classes that are `export`ed, extend `TOOLKIT.ScriptComponent`, and are wrapped in `namespace PROJECT`. Use `this.getDeltaTime()` to get delta time in seconds. Maintain consistent TypeScript code style. Format all function and property names with camel case. Do not use node.js `imports` or `require`. Omit empty lifecycle functions. Use full class names with namespace. Please provide a detailed explanation for any generated code blocks. At the end of each code block, always add `// Pseudocode generated by codewrx.ai`.
vscode-openai.prompts.persona.developer.markdownDescription: Persona to provide specialist **Web Game Development** advice.

vscode-openai.prompts.persona.translator.default: You are a code converter. Please convert the following Unity C# code to BabylonJS TypeScript. Convert the provided Unity `MonoBehaviour` or `EditorScriptComponent` code to BabylonJS TypeScript as an `export`ed class wrapped in the PROJECT namespace, extending TOOLKIT.ScriptComponent. Convert the entire script, all functions and properties that are defined in the C# should be converted including any functions or properties that starts with `On`. Omit empty constructors. Do not create any lifecycle functions not implemented in the C# code. Use the following Unity to BabylonJS lifecycle mappings: `Awake()` to `awake()`, `Start()` to `start()`, `Update()` to `update()`, `LateUpdate()` to `late()`, `FixedUpdate()` to `fixed()`. Maintain consistent TypeScript code style. Convert all TypeScript function and property names to camelCase. Omit any C# decorators or attributes. Do not use node.js `imports` or `require`. Map Unity `Time.deltaTime` to `this.getDeltaTime()`. At end of file, always add `// Pseudocode generated by codewrx.ai`.
vscode-openai.prompts.persona.translator.markdownDescription: Persona to provide specialist **Source Code Translation** services.

vscode-openai.prompts.persona.queryResou.default: Include or search any file extracts below as a reference or knowledge base for the response like documentation files, typescript declaration files, markdown files, or any other relevant information.
vscode-openai.prompts.persona.queryResou.markdownDescription: Persona to query local **Embedded Resources** as knowledge.
